Utilities¶

MathProgram contains a large number of utility functions that can be used generally among the different parts of the program.

utils.py¶

The utility functions are all stored in this file.

utils.get_q_gens(file)[source]¶

Attempts to access all files within Math_Program.Classes.sub_class. Note that this is different than the get_q_gens function in the main drivers.py file.

Parameters

file (str) – The directory of the class (for example, Algebra2).

Returns

an aggregated dictionary of all q-gen lists from the various files.

Return type

dict

utils.group_q_gens(q_gens)[source]¶

Groups question generators by their ‘type’ attribute.

Parameters

q_gens (list) – A list of question generators.

Returns

a dictionary (key: value) -> (question type: list of question generators)

utils.make_q_gen_ordering(file)[source]¶

Searches through all the .py topic files under the root :param file: and aggregates the QuestionGenerators’s directions (of type str) to a dictionary. This function is used to order the topics on the website display.

# { # subject: { # topic: { # subtopic: [directions, …], # …, # }, # … # }, # … # }

Parameters

file – The root file in the same directory as the classes (ex. Algebra1) folder.

Returns

An ordering of directions we currently support.

Return type

dict

utils.make_questions(q_gen_map, topic_name, num)[source]¶

For a single question topic type, choose from a list of question generators and return a json-like dictionary to organize topic questions.

# { # topicName # num # groups # }

Parameters

  • q_gens (list) – A list of QuestionGenerators to make questions from

  • num (int) – The number of questions to generate from this q-gen

Return type

dict

utils.worksheet_latex_output(q_gens, num=5)[source]¶

Generates a worksheet with problems from q-gens in questions. Opens the worksheet in a web browser.

Parameters

  • q_gens (list or dict) – The collection of q-gens. Either a list of q-gens or a dictionary of {topic_name: [q-gens]} values.

  • num (int) – The number of problems per q-gen
